Event.0: American politician Ed Koch—who had served as mayor of New York City (1978–89), earning a reputation for tenacity and brashness—died at age 88.
Event.1:
Space shuttle Columbia destroyed
On this day in 2003, while returning to Earth from an orbital mission, the U.S. space shuttle Columbia broke up catastrophically at an altitude of about 60 km (40 miles) over Texas, killing all seven crew members.
Event.2: Space Shuttle Columbia disintegrates during reentry into the Earth's atmosphere, killing all seven astronauts aboard.
Event.3: Singer Diana Ross marries Norwegian businessman Arne Naess in Switzerland
Event.4: The spacecraft Voyager 1 photographed Jupiter from a distance of 32.7 million km (20.3 million miles).
Event.5: Ayatollah Khomeini returns to Iran after 15 years in exile
Event.6:
Gabriel Batistuta
Argentine soccer player
was born
Event.7:
Andrew James Breitbart
American political Internet publisher
was born
Event.8: Saigon police chief Nguyễn Ngọc Loan executes Viet Cong officer Nguyễn Văn Lém with a pistol shot to head. The execution is captured by photographer Eddie Adams and becomes an anti-war icon.
Event.9: Australian Championships Men's Tennis: In a classic all-Australian final Rod Laver beats Neale Fraser 5-7, 3-6, 6-3, 8-6, 8-6; Laver's first Grand Slam title win
Event.10: Protesting a segregated lunch counter at a Woolworth's in Greensboro, North Carolina, four African Americans began a sit-in; its success led to a wider sit-in movement throughout the South.
Event.11: Film director Frank Capra (34) weds secretary Lucille Reyburn
Event.12: The private army of Blackshirts that had helped Benito Mussolini come to power in Italy was officially transformed into a national militia, the Voluntary Fascist Militia for National Security.
Event.13: King Carlos I of Portugal and his heir, Prince Luis Filipe are assassinated by Republican sympathizers in Terreiro do Paco, Lisbon
Event.14:
Langston Hughes
American poet
was born
Event.15: American writer Langston Hughes, one of the foremost interpreters to the world of the black experience in the United States, was born.
Event.16:
Clark Gable
American actor
was born
Event.17: American motion-picture star Clark Gable was born in Cadiz, Ohio.
Event.18: Giacomo Puccini's Opera "La Boheme" premieres in Turin
Event.19: Giacomo Puccini premiered his opera La Bohème at the Teatro Regio in Turin, Italy.
Event.20:
John Ford
American director
was born
Event.21: Thomas Edison completes worlds 1st movie studio at West Orange, New Jersey
Event.22: The first of 10 volumes of the Oxford English Dictionary was published in London, the final volume being published April 19, 1928.
Event.23: 1st volume of the Oxford English Dictionary, A-Ant, published
Event.24: Oldest continuous writer of insurance in America - The Mutual Life Insurance Company of New York (MONY) opens
Event.25: Novelist Alexandre Dumas (37) weds actress Ida Ferrier
Event.26: In a battle fought at Cepeda, Argentina, federalist forces defeated unitarios, who were advocates of strong central government.
Event.27: The first session of the Supreme Court of the United States was held, in New York City.
Event.28: Queen Elizabeth I of England signs death warrant for her cousin, Mary Stuart, Queen of Scots
